title: Cats
description: Meet the domesticated cat's wild cousins, great and small.
author: OneZoom

template_data.title: Cats tour
template_data.window_text: The cat was domesticated around 9500 years ago. Its closest living relative is the European wildcat. They share a common ancestor around two million years ago.

template_data.title: European wildcat
template_data.window_text: The European wildcat remains widespread. The populations living in Scotland are considered a subspecies known as the Scottish wildcat. Unfortunately Scottish wildcats are threatend by interbreeding with domesticated cats.

template_data.title: Smallest cat
window_text: The smallest living species of cat is...

template_data.title: Largest cat
window_text: The largest living species of cat is...

window_text.text: ... the tiger. Specifically, the subspecies called the Amur tiger (also known as the Siberian tiger), can weigh over 300 kg, that's 4 times as much as an adult human.

template_data.title: Roaring
template_data.window_text: Of all the cats, only the lion, tiger, jaguar and leopard have the ability to roar.

template_data.title: Purring
template_data.window_text: Although no other cats can roar, many of them can purr, like a family pet!

template_data.title: All the cats
template_data.window_text: Overall there are around 40 species of cat and they share a common ancestor about 14 million years ago.

template_data.title: Cat relatives
template_data.window_text: The closest relatives of the cats are the hyenas.

template_data.title: Carnivora
template_data.window_text: The cats and hyenas together are part of a much larger group, the Carnivora. This group also contains dogs, foxes, bears and many others. With our complete tree of life explorer, you can zoom in and out to see them all and much more.
